alert.note: Alert for Macon (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 03 at 8:51PM CST until February 05 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Bullock, Macon, Montgomery and Pike. * WHEN...Until midnight CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 851 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tuskegee, Union Springs, Meadville, Franklin Field, Hardaway, Shopton, Beans Crossroads, Liverpool, Davisville, Pine Level, Lake Tuskegee, Guerryton, Dublin, Ansley, Kent, Ramer, Grady, Society Hill, Strata and Naftel.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
